## Getting Started


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(sf, sfdep, tmap, tidyverse)
```
:::


## Import Geospatial Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial",
                 layer = "Hunan")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Reading layer `Hunan' from data source 
  `C:\Users\yapho\Documents\SMU\smu y4\is415\hxyap_IS415\In-Class_Ex\ICE-6\data\geospatial' 
  using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 88 features and 7 fields
Geometry type: POLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 108.7831 ymin: 24.6342 xmax: 114.2544 ymax: 30.12812
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan2012 <- read_csv("data/aspatial/Hunan_2012.csv")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Rows: 88 Columns: 29
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (2): County, City
dbl (27): avg_wage, deposite, FAI, Gov_Rev, Gov_Exp, GDP, GDPPC, GIO, Loan, ...

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hunan_GDPPC <- left_join(hunan, hunan2012) %>%
  select(1:4, 7, 15)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Joining with `by = join_by(County)`
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tmap_mode("plot")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
tmap mode set to plotting
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(hunan_GDPPC) +
  tm_fill("GDPPC", 
          style = "quantile", 
          palette = "Blues",
          title = "GDPPC") +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Distribution of GDP per capita by county, Hunan Province",
            main.title.position = "center",
            main.title.size = 0.8,
            legend.height = 0.45, 
            legend.width = 0.35,
            frame = TRUE) +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_compass(type="8star", size = 2) +
  tm_scale_bar() +
  tm_grid(alpha =0.2)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Global Measures of Spatial Association

### Deriving Queen's Contiguity Weights


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
wm_q <- hunan_GDPPC %>%
  mutate(nb = st_contiguity(geometry),
         wt = st_weights(nb,
                         style = "W"),
         .before = 1) 
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
wm_q
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}


:::
:::


### Global Moran's I


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
moranI <- global_moran(wm_q$GDPPC,
                       wm_q$nb,
                       wm_q$wt)
glimpse(moranI)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
List of 2
 $ I: num 0.301
 $ K: num 7.64
```


:::
:::


### Performing Global Moran's I Test


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
global_moran_test(wm_q$GDPPC,
                       wm_q$nb,
                       wm_q$wt)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	Moran I test under randomisation

data:  x  
weights: listw    

Moran I statistic standard deviate = 4.7351, p-value = 1.095e-06
alternative hypothesis: greater
sample estimates:
Moran I statistic       Expectation          Variance 
      0.300749970      -0.011494253       0.004348351 
```


:::
:::


### Perofrming Global Moran's I Permutation Test


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
set.seed(42)
global_moran_perm(wm_q$GDPPC,
                       wm_q$nb,
                       wm_q$wt,
                  nsim = 99)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

	Monte-Carlo simulation of Moran I

data:  x 
weights: listw  
number of simulations + 1: 100 

statistic = 0.30075, observed rank = 100, p-value < 2.2e-16
alternative hypothesis: two.sided
```


:::
:::


## Local Measures of Spatial Association

### Local Moran's I


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lisa <- wm_q %>% 
  mutate(local_moran = local_moran(
    GDPPC, nb, wt, nsim = 99),
         .before = 1) %>%
  unnest(local_moran)
```
:::


### Visualizing Local Moran's I


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(lisa) +
  tm_fill("ii") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_view(set.zoom.limits = c(6,8)) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "local Moran's I of GDPPC",
            main.title.size = 0.8)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Variable(s) "ii" contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set midpoint = NA to show the full spectrum of the color palette.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-12-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Visualizing p-value of Local Moran's I


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(lisa) +
  tm_fill("p_ii_sim") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
   tm_layout(main.title = "p-value of local Moran's I",
            main.title.size = 0.8)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Visualizing Local Moran's I and p-value


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
map1 <- tm_shape(lisa) +
  tm_fill("ii") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_view(set.zoom.limits = c(6,8)) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "local Moran's I of GDPPC",
            main.title.size = 0.8)

map2 <- tm_shape(lisa) +
  tm_fill("p_ii",
          breaks = c(0, 0.001, 0.01, 0.05, 1),
              labels = c("0.001", "0.01", "0.05", "Not sig")) + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "p-value of local Moran's I",
            main.title.size = 0.8)

tmap_arrange(map1, map2, ncol = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Variable(s) "ii" contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set midpoint = NA to show the full spectrum of the color palette.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-14-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Visualizing LISA Map


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lisa_sig <- lisa  %>%
  filter(p_ii < 0.05)
tm_shape(lisa) +
  tm_polygons() +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
tm_shape(lisa_sig) +
  tm_fill("mean") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: One tm layer group has duplicated layer types, which are omitted. To
draw multiple layers of the same type, use multiple layer groups (i.e. specify
tm_shape prior to each of them).
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## Hotspot Analysis

### Computing Local Gi\* Statistics


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
wm_idw <- hunan_GDPPC %>%
  mutate(nb = st_contiguity(geometry),
         wts = st_inverse_distance(nb, geometry,
                                   scale = 1,
                                   alpha = 1),
         .before = 1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
! Polygon provided. Using point on surface.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: There was 1 warning in `stopifnot()`.
ℹ In argument: `wts = st_inverse_distance(nb, geometry, scale = 1, alpha = 1)`.
Caused by warning in `st_point_on_surface.sfc()`:
! st_point_on_surface may not give correct results for longitude/latitude data
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
HCSA <- wm_idw %>% 
  mutate(local_Gi = local_gstar_perm(
    GDPPC, nb, wt, nsim = 99),
         .before = 1) %>%
  unnest(local_Gi)
HCSA
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
Simple feature collection with 88 features and 18 fields

Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 108.7831 ymin: 24.6342 xmax: 114.2544 ymax: 30.12812
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84

#   geometry <POLYGON [°]>
```


:::
:::


### Visualizing Gi\*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(HCSA) +
  tm_fill("gi_star") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_view(set.zoom.limits = c(6,8)) +
  tm_legend(legend.text.size = 0.8)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Variable(s) "gi_star" contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set midpoint = NA to show the full spectrum of the color palette.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-18-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Visualising p-value of HCSA


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
tm_shape(HCSA) +
  tm_fill("p_sim") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-19-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Visuaising Local HCSA


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
map1 <- tm_shape(HCSA) +
  tm_fill("gi_star") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_view(set.zoom.limits = c(6,8)) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "Gi* of GDPPC",
            main.title.size = 0.8)

map2 <- tm_shape(HCSA) +
  tm_fill("p_value",
          breaks = c(0, 0.001, 0.01, 0.05, 1),
              labels = c("0.001", "0.01", "0.05", "Not sig")) + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
  tm_layout(main.title = "p-value of Gi*",
            main.title.size = 0.8)

tmap_arrange(map1, map2, ncol = 2)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Variable(s) "gi_star" contains positive and negative values, so midpoint is set to 0. Set midpoint = NA to show the full spectrum of the color palette.
```


:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](ice6_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### Visualising HCSA Areas


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
HCSA_sig <- HCSA  %>%
  filter(p_sim < 0.05)
tm_shape(HCSA) +
  tm_polygons() +
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.5) +
tm_shape(HCSA_sig) +
  tm_fill("gi_star") + 
  tm_borders(alpha = 0.4)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: One tm layer group has duplicated layer types, which are omitted. To
draw multiple layers of the same type, use multiple layer groups (i.e. specify
tm_shape prior to each of them).
```

